Data.event_text: The 2018 North American cold wave takes place, with record low temperatures in the Midwestern and Eastern United States. Times Square in New York City has a temperature of 9 °F (−13 °C), with −4 °F (−20 °C) wind chill, in addition to Omaha having a temperature of −15 °F (−26 °C) on December 30, 2017, lower than the previous record set in 1884.

links.text: -Waldrop, Theresa; Shoichet, Catherine E. "New year brings record cold across US". CNN.-
-"Dangerously Cold Temperatures Grip Midwest as 2018 Begins". Time. Archived from the original on January 1, 2018. Retrieved January 2, 2018.-
-"Dangerously Cold Temperatures Grip Midwest as 2018 Begins". Time. Archived from the original on January 1, 2018. Retrieved January 2, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The 2018 Southern California landslides occur, killing at least 13 people, and injuring 25.  The main damage occurs in Montecito, California, which was nearly burned by the Thomas Fire a month prior.

Data.event_text: During a meeting with lawmakers about immigration, President Trump is reported to have asked, "Why are we having all these people from shithole countries come here?" His remarks are condemned as "racist" and "shocking" by a UN spokesman. (comp. Donald Trump racial views) The government of Botswana demands a clarification, and Ambassador Earl R. Miller is asked if the USDS regards Botswana as a "shithole" country. The event is termed by many media outlets "Shitholegate".

links.text: -"Trump derides protections for immigrants from 'shithole' countries". The Washington Post. January 12, 2018. Retrieved January 12, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The 90th Academy Awards, hosted by Jimmy Kimmel, are held at Dolby Theatre in Hollywood, with Guillermo del Toro's The Shape of Water winning four awards out of 13 nominations, including Best Picture and Best Director. Data.event_text: Avengers Infinity War, directed by the Russo brothers, is released by Marvel Studios as the 19th film of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and the sequel to 2012's The Avengers and 2015's Avengers Age of Ultron. Data.event_text: NASA's InSight spacecraft, designed to study the interior and subsurface of Mars, successfully launches at 1105 UTC, with an expected arrival on November 26, 2018.
The state of California becomes the world's fifth-largest economy, with the state's GDP surpassing that of the United Kingdom's.

links.text: -"California becomes the world's fifth-biggest economy". The Hill. May 5, 2018.-

Data.event_text: In horse racing, pre-race favorite Justify wins the 144th running of the Kentucky Derby, becoming the first horse since 1882 to win the race while unraced as a two-year-old. The race was run under the wettest conditions in its history; by post time, more than 2.8 inches (7.1 cm) of rain had fallen on race day, breaking a record that had lasted since 1918.

The Senate Intelligence Committee releases an unclassified version of its investigation into Russian cyberattacks in 2016, concluding "Russian-affiliated cyber actors were able to gain access to restricted elements of election infrastructure. [...] In a small number of states, these cyber actors were in a position to, at a minimum, alter or delete voter registration data; however, they did not appear to be in a position to manipulate individual votes or aggregate vote totals."

links.text: -"Senate Intel: Russia waged 'unprecedented' cyber campaign on U.S. voting systems". The Hill. May 8, 2018. Retrieved May 10, 2018.-

Data.event_text: New York's attorney general Eric Schneiderman resigns over multiple allegations of assault.

links.text: -"New York AG Eric Schneiderman resigns over assault allegations". CNN. May 8, 2018. Retrieved May 8, 2018.-

Data.event_text: President Trump announces his intention to withdraw the United States from the Iranian nuclear agreement. In a statement, former U.S. President Barack Obama calls the move "a serious mistake".

links.text: -Rowland, Geoffrey (May 8, 2018). "Trump pulls US out of Iran nuke deal". The Hill.-
-"'A serious mistake': Read Barack Obama's statement on President Trump's decision to pull out of the Iran nuclear deal". CNBC. May 8, 2018.-

-"Assessing the U.S. Climate in April 2018". ncei.noaa.gov. May 2018.-

Data.event_text: The California Energy Commission introduces its 2019 Building Energy Efficiency Standards, requiring all new homes to be fitted with solar power from 2020. It is the first state in the US to enact such a law.

links.text: -"President Trump Welcomes U.S. Detainees Freed from North Korea". Time. Archived from the original on May 10, 2018.-
-"President Trump Welcomes U.S. Detainees Freed from North Korea". Time. Archived from the original on May 10, 2018.-

Data.event_text: NASA's Carbon Monitoring System (CMS) is cancelled by the Trump administration.

Data.event_text: President Trump meets with Shavkat Mirziyoyev.
The Kīlauea shield volcano on the Big Island of the state of Hawaii erupts from its summit, shooting ash 30,000 feet (9,100 m) into the sky.

links.text: -"Hawaii volcano erupts from summit, shooting plume of ash". CBS News. May 17, 2018. Retrieved May 17, 2018.-

Data.event_text: A school shooting takes place at Santa Fe High School in Santa Fe, Texas. Eight students and two teachers are killed and thirteen other people are injured.
U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin states that the Trump administration will put its proposed tariffs on Chinese imports "on hold", averting fears of a trade war between the two countries.

links.text: -"US and China put trade war 'on hold'". The Guardian. May 20, 2018. Retrieved May 21, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The Supreme Court, in a 54 ruling, upholds a law preventing employees from filing class action lawsuits against their employers over pay and hour disputes.

links.text: -Rowland, Geoffrey (May 21, 2018). "Supreme Court upholds agreements that prevent employee class-action suits". The Hill.-

Data.event_text: Harvey Weinstein is charged with rape and several other counts of sexual abuse involving two separate women after turning himself in to police in New York City.

links.text: -"Harvey Weinstein charged with rape following New York arrest". BBC News. May 25, 2018. Retrieved May 25, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The Center for the Study of the Drone at New York's Bard College estimates that just over 900 law enforcement agencies, fire departments, and emergency services across the country are now using drones, no longer seen as a novelty by officials.

links.text: -"Law enforcement agencies turning to drones to fight crime". fox5ny.com.-

Data.event_text: ABC TV cancels comedian Roseanne Barr's show after she tweets a racist comment, likening Valerie Jarrett to an ape.

Data.event_text: Missouri Governor Eric Greitens announces his resignation (effective ) amid a sex scandal.

Data.event_text: Starbucks temporarily closes its stores for one day to undergo racial sensitivity training following an incident in April in which two black men were arrested in its Philadelphia store.
By a majority of 2312, the California State Senate votes to approve a bill that would reinstate the net neutrality regulations repealed by the Federal Communications Commission in December.

links.text: -"California Senate votes to restore net neutrality". The Verge. May 30, 2018. Retrieved May 31, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The FDA approves the first artificial iris.

links.text: -"FDA approves first artificial iris". FDA. May 30, 2018. Retrieved June 1, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The Trump administration announces that it will extend its tariffs on imported steel (25%) and aluminium (10%) to include the EU, Mexico and Canada, starting at midnight.

links.text: -"US tariffs: Steel and aluminium levies slapped on key allies". BBC News. May 31, 2018. Retrieved May 31, 2018.-

Data.event_text: In a 72 decision (Masterpiece Cakeshop v. Colorado Civil Rights Commission), the Supreme Court rules in favor of a Colorado baker who, citing the First Amendment's protection of religion, refused to create a customized wedding cake for a homosexual couple.

links.text: -"Court sides with Colorado baker on same-sex wedding cake". Australian Broadcasting Corporation. June 4, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The Washington Capitals defeat the Vegas Golden Knights in game five of the 2018 Stanley Cup Finals to give the Capitals their first Stanley Cup in franchise history and the first championship for the city of D.C. since the Redskins won Super Bowl XXVI. Capitals left-winger Alex Ovechkin is the playoff MVP.

The U.S. Department of Energy's Oak Ridge National Laboratory unveils Summit as the world's most powerful supercomputer, with a peak performance of 200,000 trillion calculations per second, or 200 petaflops.

links.text: -"ORNL Launches Summit Supercomputer". Oak Ridge National Laboratory. June 8, 2018. Retrieved June 9, 2018.-
-"Summit Up and Running at Oak Ridge, Claims First Exascale Application". Top500. June 9, 2018. Retrieved June 9, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain and fashion designer Kate Spade both die of suicide, leading to growing concerns of alarming public health that can lead to people living with breakdowns and mental health before asking others if can have any intention on taking their own lives.
The Golden State Warriors defeat the Cleveland Cavaliers, four games to none, to win the NBA Championship.
9  At the G7 summit in Canada, President Trump pushes for the reinstatement of the G8 (to include Russia). He also proposes the elimination of tariffs.

links.text: -"Trump at G7: US president calls for end to tariffs and trade barriers". BBC News. June 9, 2018. Retrieved June 9, 2018.-

Data.event_text: 12  In a historic first, President Trump meets with Supreme Leader of North Korea, Kim Jong-un, in Singapore.

links.text: -"Trump Kim summit: US president hails deal after historic talks". BBC News. June 12, 2018. Retrieved June 12, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Federal judge Amy Berman Jackson cancels Paul Manafort's bail and orders that he be jailed for alleged witness tampering.

links.text: -"Paul Manafort jailed by judge for alleged witness tampering". BBC News. June 15, 2018. Retrieved June 15, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Pixar Animation Studios' 20th feature film, Incredibles 2, the sequel to 2004's The Incredibles, is released in theaters. It is currently Pixar's biggest financial success, grossing over $1.242 billion worldwide.
A shooting at an all-night arts festival in Trenton, New Jersey, leaves one person dead and seventeen people injured.

links.text: -Ferré-Sadurní, Luis; Zaveri, Mihir (June 17, 2018). "One Dead, 17 Shot at New Jersey Arts Festival". The New York Times. Retrieved June 17, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Rapper XXXTentacion is shot and killed in Deerfield Beach, FL on the same day fellow rapper Jimmy Wopo is also shot and killed in his hometown of Pittsburgh.

Data.event_text: In a landmark 54 decision that overturns Abood v. Detroit Board of Education (1977), the Supreme Court rules in Janus v. AFSCME that it is a violation of the First Amendment for public-sector unions to compel non-members to pay fair-share representation fees.

Associate Justice Anthony Kennedy announces that he will retire from the United States Supreme Court on , prompting Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to vow that Kennedy's successor will be confirmed by the fall.
The 2018 North American heat wave begins.

Data.event_text: Ant-Man and the Wasp, directed by Peyton Reed, is released by Marvel Studios as the 20th film of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and the sequel to 2015's Ant-Man.

President Trump nominates Brett Kavanaugh, a circuit judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit, to become an Associate Justice for the Supreme Court of the United States.
President Trump attends the NATO Summit in Brussels.

President Trump arrives in the UK. The four-day visit includes talks with Theresa May, tea with the Queen and a trip to Scotland. There are mass protests in London, featuring a 'Trump baby' blimp flown over Westminster.

Data.event_text: Tesfaye Cooper is convicted of hate crime and aggravated kidnapping charges in Illinois and sentenced to seven years in prison for his role in the 2017 Chicago torture incident. He is the fourth and final member of an African-American group to be convicted in relation to the kidnapping of a mentally disabled white man in Chicago who livestreamed their torture of him on Facebook, shouting "Fuck Trump" and "Fuck white people" while doing so.

links.text: -"Final defendant in Facebook hate crime case sentenced to 7 years". Chicago Sun-Times.-

Data.event_text: The share price of Facebook drops by almost 20 percent after the company warns investors that user growth has slowed following the Cambridge Analytica data leak scandal. Data.event_text: NASA launches ICESat-2, the agency's most technologically advanced ice-monitoring spacecraft to date.

links.text: -ICESat will get unprecedented view of Earth's ice, BBC News, September 15, 2018, retrieved September 15, 2018-

Data.event_text: Christine Blasey Ford alleges that Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh sexually assaulted her in the early 1980s.

links.text: -"California professor, writer of confidential Brett Kavanaugh letter, speaks out about her allegation of sexual assault". The Washington Post. Retrieved September 16, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Christine Blasey Ford agrees to testify against Brett Kavanaugh the following week.

links.text: -Brett Kavanaugh: Judge accuser agrees to testify on Thursday, BBC News, September 22, 2018, retrieved September 22, 2018-

Data.event_text: A second woman comes forward with sexual misconduct claims against Brett Kavanaugh.

links.text: -Brett Kavanaugh: Embattled Trump nominee 'not going anywhere', BBC News, September 24, 2018, retrieved September 24, 2018-

Data.event_text: TV star Bill Cosby, 81, is given a three to 10-year jail term for drugging and molesting a woman in 2004. Judge Steven O'Neill designates Cosby a "sexually violent predator", meaning he must undergo counselling for life and be listed on the sex offender registry.

links.text: -Bill Cosby sentenced to state prison for sexual assault, BBC News, September 25, 2018, retrieved September 25, 2018-

Data.event_text: A third woman accuses Brett Kavanaugh of sexual misconduct.

links.text: -"Brett Kavanaugh: third woman accuses supreme court nominee of sexual misconduct", The Guardian, September 26, 2018, retrieved September 26, 2018-

Data.event_text: Christine Blasey Ford appears before a Senate Judiciary Committee to give evidence against Brett Kavanaugh.

links.text: -Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh rebuts abuse allegation, BBC News, September 27, 2018, retrieved September 27, 2018-

Data.event_text: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) files a suit in New York alleging securities fraud by Tesla CEO Elon Musk.

links.text: -Regulators accuse Tesla's Elon Musk of securities fraud, BBC News, September 27, 2018, retrieved September 27, 2018-

Data.event_text: The Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi is murdered inside the Saudi consulate in Istanbul, triggering a diplomatic crisis between the U.S. and Saudi Arabia.

A Star Is Born is theatrically released by Warner Bros. A remake of the 1934, 1957 and 1976 versions, it was a critical and commercial success, grossing over $436 million worldwide and receiving praise for the performances Bradley Cooper (who also directed), Lady Gaga and Sam Elliott as well as the screenplay, cinematography and music.
The Senate confirms Brett Kavanaugh's Supreme Court nomination by a vote of 5048, amid controversy over sexual assault claims against him.

Twenty people are killed in a crash involving a limousine transporting birthday party guests in Schoharie County, New York. It is the deadliest transport crash in the U.S. since Colgan Air Flight 3407, also in New York state, which claimed 50 lives in 2009.

links.text: -"Limo crash leaves 20 dead in New York state". BBC News. October 7, 2018. Retrieved October 7, 2018.-
-"New York limo crash: Car had failed road safety test". BBC News. October 8, 2018. Retrieved October 8, 2018.-

Data.event_text: America's ambassador to the UN, Nikki Haley, a senior Trump cabinet member, resigns unexpectedly.

links.text: -"Nikki Haley: US ambassador to UN resigns". BBC News. October 9, 2018. Retrieved October 9, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Hurricane Michael approaches the Florida Panhandle, attaining peak wind speeds of 155 mph (250 km/h) and becoming the strongest hurricane to ever make landfall in that region.

After 50 years of performing the characters Big Bird and Oscar the Grouch, longtime Sesame Street puppeteer Caroll Spinney announces his retirement in 2015. Spinney's role was limited to voice only due to health problems.
President Trump announces that the US will "terminate" the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty over alleged Russian violations.

links.text: -"President Trump to pull US from Russia missile treaty". BBC News. October 21, 2018. Retrieved October 21, 2018.-

Data.event_text: After a bomb was found at the home of George Soros in the suburbs of New York, suspected explosive devices are also sent to former US President Barack Obama and ex-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton. The latter devices are intercepted by technicians who screen mail sent to former US officials. The Time Warner building in New York (home to news broadcaster CNN) is also evacuated, after a package containing an explosive and suspicious powder is found addressed to former CIA Director John Brennan. Additional suspicious packages, addressed to Democratic Representative Maxine Waters and former Attorney General Eric Holder, are investigated by law enforcement.

links.text: -"'Explosive devices' sent to Clinton, Obama, CNN, and other US officials". BBC News. October 24, 2018. Retrieved October 24, 2018.-

Data.event_text: A suspicious package is found in Tribeca, New York City, addressed to actor Robert De Niro. Authorities also find two packages in Delaware, addressed to former Vice President Joe Biden.

links.text: -"Two new pipe bombs said to target Joe Biden". Vice. October 25, 2018. Retrieved October 26, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Two more suspicious packages are found, addressed to New Jersey senator Cory Booker and the former director of national intelligence, James Clapper.

links.text: -"Suspicious packages addressed to Cory Booker and James Clapper discovered". The Guardian. October 26, 2018. Retrieved October 26, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The perpetrator, Cesar Sayoc Jr., is captured in Plantation, Florida, in connection with the mail bombing attempts. He is questioned by FBI agents with the Joint Terrorism Task Force.

links.text: -"Pipe bombs: man arrested in Florida over explosive devices – live updates". The Guardian. October 26, 2018. Retrieved October 26, 2018.-

Data.event_text: A mass shooting occurs at the Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, leaving 11 congregants dead. A 46-year-old male suspect is arrested and charged on making anti-semitic chants.

links.text: -Mele, Cristopher (October 27, 2018). "Pittsburgh Synagogue Shooting Leaves 'Several' Dead, Official Says". The New York Times. Retrieved October 27, 2018.-
-Andone, Dakin; Allen, Keith (October 27, 2018). "Hate crime charges filed in Pittsburgh synagogue shooting that left 11 dead". CNN. Retrieved October 27, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The Boston Red Sox defeat the Los Angeles Dodgers, four games to one, to win their ninth World Series Championship.
800 U.S. soldiers are deployed to the MexicoUnited States border as a part of Operation Faithful Patriot, reinforcing the border against incoming Central American migrant caravans.

links.text: -Burns, Arthur (October 29, 2018). "Pentagon to Send 5,200 Troops to Border, Becerra Calls Deployment 'Disturbing'". KQED-FM. Retrieved October 29, 2018.-

Data.event_text: NASA announces that its Kepler space telescope mission has ended, with the telescope having run out of fuel two weeks before, after nine-and-a-half years in space. The telescope discovered 2,681 exoplanets, with a further 2,900 candidates at the time of its retirement. The spacecraft also discovered that there are more planets than stars in our galaxy.

links.text: -Briefing Materials: RELEASE 18-092: NASA Retires the Kepler Space Telescope NASA, October 30, 2018.-
-RIP, Kepler: NASA's Revolutionary Planet-Hunting Telescope Runs Out of Fuel Space.com, October 30, 2018.-
-NASA's Planet-Hunting Kepler Space Telescope Is Done. What Will Happen to It? Space.com, October 31, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The Supreme Court of Hawaii approves the resumption of construction on Mauna Kea of one of the world's biggest telescopes, the Thirty Meter Telescope, costing $1.4 billion. Some native Hawaiians, regarding the mountain as sacred, opposed the construction since 2015.

links.text: -Hawaii top court approves controversial Thirty Meter Telescope BBC News, October 31, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Bohemian Rhapsody, a biographical film about Queen singer Freddie Mercury, is released in theaters nationwide, becoming a major box office success, grossing over $905 million worldwide on a production budget of about $50 million, becoming the sixth-highest-grossing film of 2018 worldwide and setting the all-time box office records for the biopic and drama genres.
Mid-term elections The Democrats gain 40 seats to take control of the House of Representatives, but lose two seats in the Senate.
Gubernatorial elections The Democrats gain seven new seats.
Michigan becomes the tenth state to legalize recreational marijuana.

links.text: -"Michigan becomes 10th state to legalize recreational marijuana; other measures pass in Missouri and Utah". The Denver Post. November 7, 2018. Retrieved November 8, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Attorney General Jeff Sessions tenders his resignation at President Trump's request.
12 people and the perpetrator are killed in a shooting at the Borderline Bar and Grill, in Thousand Oaks, California, about 40 miles (65 km) north-west of Los Angeles.

links.text: -"Thousand Oaks: Ex-Marine Ian David Long identified as suspect". BBC News. November 8, 2018. Retrieved November 8, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The White House shares apparently doctored footage posted by InfoWars, a conspiracy theory website, showing Jim Acosta making contact with a Trump aide, in a bid to justify its suspension of the CNN reporter's press pass.

links.text: -"Jim Acosta: White House shares apparently doctored video posted by conspiracy site InfoWars to justify suspending CNN reporter's press pass". The Independent. November 8, 2018. Archived from the original on May 1, 2022. Retrieved November 8, 2018.-

-"Jim Acosta: White House shares apparently doctored video posted by conspiracy site InfoWars to justify suspending CNN reporter's press pass". The Independent. November 8, 2018. Archived from the original on May 1, 2022. Retrieved November 8, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Federal judge Brian Morris rules that the Keystone Pipeline cannot be built until a new Environmental impact assessment is completed. Four months later, on March 30, 2019, President Donald Trump issued a new permit.

links.text: -"Federal Judge Halts Construction of Keystone XL Pipeline". Huffpost. November 9, 2018. Retrieved April 3, 2019.-
-Papenfuss, Mary (March 30, 2019). "Trump Sidesteps Court Order, Issues Edict To Build Controversial Keystone XL Pipeline". Huffpost. Retrieved April 3, 2019.-

Data.event_text: 25  Major wildfires in California, including the Woolsey in southern California and Camp to the north, leave 91 dead and at least 1,000 missing, with more than 250,000 residents forced to flee. President Trump suggests that wildfires could be stopped by spending "a lot of time on raking and cleaning".

links.text: -"California: Wildfires continue to spread across state". BBC News. November 10, 2018. Retrieved November 10, 2018.-
-"California fires: At least 42 die in state's deadliest wildfire". BBC News. November 13, 2018. Retrieved November 13, 2018.-
-"California wildfires: Number of missing leaps to 631". BBC News. November 16, 2018. Retrieved November 16, 2018.-
-"California wildfires: Finland bemused by Trump raking comment". BBC News. November 19, 2018. Retrieved November 19, 2018.-

Data.event_text: William Riley Gaul, a 18-year-old college football player murdered his ex-girlfriend Emma Walker in Knoxville, Tennessee.
Volume II of the Fourth National Climate Assessment (NCA4) is released.

links.text: -"On the release of NCA4 Volume II and SOCCR2: A letter from the Acting Chair of the Subcommittee on Global Change Research and our Executive Director". GlobalChange.gov. November 23, 2018. Retrieved November 24, 2018.-
-"Latest National Climate Assessment Shows US Already Suffering Damages from Climate Change". Union of Concerned Scientists. November 23, 2018. Retrieved November 24, 2018.-
-"Climate change 'will inflict substantial damages on US lives'". The Guardian. November 23, 2018. Retrieved November 24, 2018.-
-"Climate change: Report warns of growing impact on US life". BBC News. November 23, 2018. Retrieved November 24, 2018.-

Data.event_text: SpongeBob SquarePants creator Stephen Hillenburg dies at the age of 57 from ALS.
President Trump's former lawyer Michael Cohen pleads guilty to lying to Congress in relation to the Russia inquiry.

links.text: -"Michael Cohen in court: Trump ex-lawyer admits lying to Congress". BBC News. November 29, 2018. Retrieved November 29, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Former President George H. W. Bush dies from Parkinson's disease at the age of 94 at his home in Houston, Texas. His passing was announced the next morning and at the time, he was both the nation's oldest and longest living president, a record surpassed by Jimmy Carter in 2019.
Anchorage is hit by a 7.0 magnitude earthquake.

The Balangiga bells, which had been taken by the United States Army from Balangiga, Eastern Samar in 1901 as war trophies during the PhilippineAmerican War, are returned to the Philippines after 117 years of U.S. possession.

links.text: -de Guzman, Chad (December 11, 2018). "Balangiga bells now back in PH". CNNPhilippines. Archived from the original on December 15, 2018. Retrieved December 11, 2018.-
-de Guzman, Chad (December 11, 2018). "Balangiga bells now back in PH". CNNPhilippines. Archived from the original on December 15, 2018. Retrieved December 11, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Michael Cohen, the ex-Trump lawyer who once said he'd "take a bullet" for the president, is given a 36-month jail term.

links.text: -"Ex-Trump lawyer Michael Cohen jailed for 36 months". BBC News. December 12, 2018. Retrieved December 12, 2018.-

Data.event_text: In a rare rebuke to the White House, the Senate votes 5641 to end US military assistance to Saudi Arabia's intervention in Yemen over alleged war crimes. It passes a separate resolution that holds Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman personally responsible for the death of Saudi dissident Jamal Kashoggi.

links.text: -"Senate Votes to End Aid for Yemen Fight Over Khashoggi Killing and Saudis' War Aims". The New York Times. December 13, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Federal judge Reed O'Connor rules that the health insurance mandate component of the Affordable Care Act is unconstitutional.

links.text: -"Obamacare: Texas court rules key health law is unconstitutional". BBC News. December 15, 2018. Retrieved December 15, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Denise Williams is found guilty of the murder of her husband Jerry Michael Williams, who disappeared in  and was assumed to have accidentally drowned at Lake Seminole, Florida.

links.text: -Etters, Jennifer Portman and Karl. "'JUSTICE FOR MICHAEL': 18 years later, Denise guilty in murder of husband Mike Williams". Tallahassee Democrat. Retrieved November 24, 2022.-

Data.event_text: The Donald J. Trump Foundation is shut down, amid allegations that President Trump and others illegally misused its funds.

links.text: -"Donald Trump's troubled charity foundation to shut down". BBC News. December 18, 2018. Retrieved December 18, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Defense Secretary Jim Mattis resigns, effective February 28, 2019, after failing to persuade Trump to reconsider his decision of the previous day to withdraw the remaining American troops from Syria.

links.text: -Cooper, Helene (December 20, 2018). "Jim Mattis, Marine General Turned Defense Secretary, Will Leave Pentagon in February". The New York Times. Retrieved December 20, 2018.-
-O'Brien, Connor; Bender, Brien (December 20, 2018). "Mattis breaks with Trump in resignation letter". Politico. Retrieved December 20, 2018.-

Data.event_text: The Dow Jones closes at 22,445.37 after its worst week since 2008.

links.text: -"US stocks suffer worst week in a decade". BBC News. December 21, 2018. Retrieved December 23, 2018.-
-"Dow dives 400 points to end its worst week in 10 years". CNBC. December 21, 2018. Retrieved December 23, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Aquaman, directed by James Wan, is released as the sixth film in the DC Extended Universe, becoming currently the franchise's biggest financial success.
A partial shutdown of the government begins after Congress fails to agree a budget.

links.text: -"US government partially shuts down over border wall row". BBC News. December 22, 2018. Retrieved December 22, 2018.-

Data.event_text: U.S. envoy Brett McGurk resigns over Trump's decision to pull troops from Syria.

links.text: -"US envoy quits over Trump Syria pullout". BBC News. December 22, 2018. Retrieved December 22, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Actor Kevin Spacey is charged with sexually assaulting a teenager at a bar in Massachusetts in July 2016 and ordered to appear in court on .

links.text: -"Kevin Spacey: Actor charged with sexual assault in Massachusetts". BBC News. December 24, 2018. Retrieved December 25, 2018.-

Data.event_text: Senator Elizabeth Warren announces her intention to run for president in the 2020 election.

links.text: -"Elizabeth Warren announces 2020 run for president against Trump". The Guardian. December 31, 2018. Retrieved December 31, 2018.-
